result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas W Perkins was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $1,200 plus costs. 
Payments due within 90 days of discharge from extended supervision.
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Provide a DNA sample if not already done so and pay the surcharge. 
Comply and cooperate with all assessments and counseling.
Complete AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Not associate with persons who are using alcohol.
Have psychological assessment and comply with recommendations.

Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held 6/16/2015
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Thomas W Perkins in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Thomas W Perkins in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:44 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Drengler states one correction to the PSI. 
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - 
Wisconsin State Prison: 2 years initial confinement followed by 30 months extended supervision: 
Credit for 292 days. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Not associate with persons who are using alcohol. 
Complete AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Have psychological assessment and comply with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample if not already done so and pay the surcharge. 
Pay fine of $1200 plus costs
$26.45 blood draw fee. 
License revocation 36 months
IID for 36 months.
Obtain employment. 
Comply and cooperate with all assessments and counseling. 
Payments due within 90 days of discharge from extended supervision.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 06-16-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Thomas W Perkins in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Thomas W Perkins in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: (plea) 14CF334, (warrant) 08FO1429 
11:51 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

BY THE COURT: In 08FO1429, Court vacates the commitment warrant because the defendant is in custody and has no ability to pay.  Directs the clerk to use other collection procedures.  Warrants are not to be sent on this file in the future. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 1 - 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Defendant agrees he has 5 prior convictions. 
BAC .215

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty OWI 6th offense.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed. 
Court orders PSI. 

Atty Drengler indicates they will be preparing a sentencing memorandum as well and asks for additional time to complete that.  

BY THE COURT:  PSI to be completed by 6/9/15 with copies forwarded to counsel to prepare for sentencing arguments.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing at 04-17-2015 11:45 am

Defendant Thomas W Perkins in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Defendant Thomas W Perkins in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:22 AM Court calls case and states appearances.

Matter is set for a bond modification hearing at this time.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, requests a wage assignment or a $10,000 signature bond or a $500 cash bond, for reasons stated on the record.
Atty Cousins addresses the Court, requests this motion be opposed for reasons stated on the record.
Atty Drengler addresses the Court, replies.
 
Court feels a significant cash bond is necessary.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies request at this time.
for Modification of Bond
Bail/Bond Review on November 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on April 22, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Written
Pre-trial conference on October 13, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Thomas W Perkins in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Thomas W Perkins in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler (Atty Drury present today).
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
